name: Days Inn & Suites - West Edmonton

reviews.text: I recently travelled to Edmonton and stayed at the Days Inn & Suites.
reviews.title: Nice Getaway

reviews.text: The location was great! Convienently close to West Edmonton Mall.
reviews.title: Problems
Our Wedding Banquet
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and helpful. My reservation was made last mintue and the front desk staff were very accomodating.
The hotel was neat and clean.
reviews.title: Great Hotel near West Edmonton Mall

reviews.text: I was able to connect to high speed internet in my room. As well, on the main floor i enjoyed the wireless internet access.
reviews.title: Recommend this Hotel!
clean new and quiet
reviews.text: just stayed 3 nights at this Days inn early October in their kids suites.

reviews.title: Not the greatest
reviews.text: We were a family of 4 adults on a tour of Western Canada by hire car and we wanted to stay at West Edmonton at the end of our 2 weeks solely to do some shopping and sightseeing at the West Edmonton Mall before flying back via Toronto to the UK. I booked through Expedia.
First challenge was finding the place. In the end I had to stop at a general store and buy a street map and even then it was not too easy because of the one-way system.
reviews.title: Not what we expected

reviews.text: On arrival there was plenty of parking. Sadly this was one of the very few places on our long journey through ever-friendly Canada where customer service was completely lacking; it was as is the reception staff could not have cared less. For example, I asked for a guide to the West Edmonton Mall and the staff would not help me. In the end I walked over to the Holiday Inn opposite and the contrast was stark; they could not have been more helpful despite the fact I was not one of their guests.
reviews.title: Top Notch Accomodation & Service
This hotel has no water!
reviews.text: The rooms were fine and reasonable value for money. They were a fair size, had comfy beds, the usual coffee maker and a big TV with lots of cable channels. We chose to eat out both nights - there are lots of family restaurants within easy walking distance. There was also some all-male convention staying in the Inn and we had to put up with other fairly drunk guests in the lift. I would advise that you should not try to walk to the West Edmonton Mall; the distance does not look far on the map but the route is not very pedestrian friendly and the roads are very busy. We drove and there is masses of parking at the Mall.

When we came to check our early morning en route to the airport we could not initially find anyone on reception. If ever we go back to West Edmonton we will be trying the Holiday Inn instead, or staying at one of the hotels in the Mall.
reviews.title: Excellent Experience

aka: Days Inn & Suites - West Edmonton Hotel
